name: Classic Jewish Chicken Soup
author: Jennifer Feher
summary: A classic recipe for 'Jewish Penicillin!' Add matzo balls if you wish, or just serve with noodles, fresh bread, or biscuits. This soup is even better reheated the next day!
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
4 large carrots, peeled and cut into cubes
2  potatoes, peeled and cut into cubes
1 large kohlrabi bulb, peeled and diced
3  parsnips, peeled and cut into cubes
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Put chicken in a large pot with the chopped onions
Pour enough water into the pot to cover; add dill, parsley, salt, and pepper
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer for 45 minutes
Skim and discard any foam from the top of the simmering liquid
Remove chicken to a cutting board
Remove as much meat from the chicken bones as possible; cut into chunks
Return the liquid to a boil
Add carrots, potatoes, leeks, celery, kohlrabi, and parsnips to the boiling liquid
Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes
Stir cooked chicken chunks and chicken bouillon into the mixture
Season again with salt and pepper
Cook until the chicken is hot, about 5 minutes
